definition[0]: the amount by which two or more things are different or by which they change
definition[1]: the official permission to do something different from what is normally allowed
example[1]: The developer requested a variance to build a shopping center on the east side of town.
definition[2]: the amount by which two or more things are different
example[2]: Thereâ€™s a wide variance in the two sets of data.
definition[3]: the difference between what something actually costs and its usual or standard cost, or its cost when calculated earlier
example[3]: A significant variance is one amounting to more than 10% of the allocated budget.
definition[4]: an arrangement in which a court of law allows a company to do something that would not normally be allowed
example[4]: The authoritygranted a variance so the company could install the satellite dish.
definition[5]: an arrangement in which a local government authority allows someone to do something to their property that would not normally be allowed
